results.title: The Green machine
results.brief_description: The Green Machine is the Australian Army, and, to the accompaniment of Tchaikovsky’s 1812 Overture, we see depicted every aspect of life in the Australian Army of 1976.

results.title: The Green hornet. Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Ford Beebe and Ray Taylor
results.brief_description: Volume 2 contains chapters 7 to 13. Based on the successful radio serial of the same name, Britt Reid (Gordon Jones) as the Green Hornet and his crime fighting partner, Kato (Keye Luke) battle against organised crime’s king-pins. The Green Hornet is the direct descendant of the famous masked crime fighter, The Lone Ranger. He’s the Lone Ranger’s grand nephew. This movie serial used the same principle characters that featured in the radio play as well as the famous Hornet musical signature (Flight of the Bumble Bee) and gadgetry such as a gas gun to incapacitate criminals. Also used is the voice of Al Hodge, the radio Green Hornet, which was heard when crusading publisher Britt Reid spoke from behind the Hornet mask. Also stars Anne Nagel as Lenore Case.

results.title: The Green city
results.brief_description: Shows how green open space is being thoughtlessly gobbled up by the urbanising process. Demonstrates how development can take place without excessive destruction and illustrates various situations in different parts of the United States. Describes man’s changing environment and fortells the consequences if this change is permitted to take place without careful planning.

results.title: The Greeks in search of meaning
results.creator_credit: John H. Secondari and Helen Jean Secondari
results.brief_description: Recreates the concerns and achievements of the Greeks in the 5th century B.C. Eternal philosophical and moral debates are dramatised through the dialogues of the era’s great thinkers. Includes excerpts from Antigone by Sophocles, and Lysistrata by Aristophanes.

results.title: The Greedy frog
results.creator_credit: Kate White Productions, South Australian Government (Film and Television Financing Fund), Kate White and Murray Lomax
results.brief_description: This aboriginal dreamtime story of The Greedy Frog is told using footage of Australian animals in the wild. Suitable for children the story tells of The Greedy Frog who drank all the water in the billabong leaving the plants and all the animals in the area without water. The koala wants to fix the situation and decides the solution is to make the frog laugh. After enlisting the help of all the other animals it is the Old Man Emu that finally saves the day.

results.title: The Greatest run on earth
results.creator_credit: Pillsbury Films, Television New Zealand and Sam Pillsbury
results.brief_description: Why does an entire city suddenly go crazy on running? In the land where jogging was ‘invented’ by Arthur Lydiard twenty years ago, a film crew looked closely at how the city of Auckland, population a mere 500,000 is convulsed by preparations for this bizarre annual event, ‘the greatest run on earth’.

results.title: The Greatest gamble
results.brief_description: Christopher Brasher assesses the gambles taken in supporting new inventions and introduces some of the men involved. Includes the trials of the Dr Barnes Wallis swing wing aircraft, and Professor F. C. Williams of Manchester University relives the moment when he saw the way of solving the problems of electronic memory. Other contributors includes Christopher Cockerell who discusses hovercraft, Geoffrey Stockdale on the take-apart ship and Donald Firth on the revolution in cars and machine tools.

results.title: The Greatest adventures of Popeye
results.brief_description: A compilation of three full length animated cartoons nominated for an Academy Award. These action filled cartoons see the famous spinach eater with Olive Oyl, Wimpy and Brutus and are entertaining for all the family. Following the exciting animations is a bonus sing-a-long complete with bouncing ball to the theme song “Popeye the Sailor Man”.

results.title: The Greater community animal
results.brief_description: An animated film which examines why the individual has to have his idiosyncrasies and his potentialities processed out of existence in order to be made acceptable to society. Considers individualism, conformism and the compromises which have to be made. American Film Festival Blue Ribbon.
